attributes.action: Adopt Terminology pre-term Labour for babies born post 16 weeks, not miscarriage
attributes.additional_details:
My Husband and I have unfortunately lost two babies. Our first was born 20/09/2016 at 19 weeks; fully formed and born with a heartbeat & lived for a few minutes. Our second child was born 08/08/2017 at 21 weeks and lived for 16 minutes.
I endured hours of labour, the same as any other mother who has delivered a baby. I find it offensive and an insult that my children are labelled as miscarriage- like they didn't exist, when they were born alive, although premature
attributes.background:
Speaking from experience, I believe the terminology "Miscarriage" should only be adopted for pregnancies lost prior to 16 weeks gestation.
Miscarriage means "loss or expulsion of an embryo before it's viable".

rejection.details:
We’re very sorry for your losses.

We can’t accept your petition because the language used in hospitals to describe the loss of pre-term babies is not the responsibility of the UK Government and Parliament. 

We have a petition to “Lower the age a stillborn can legally be registered.” which you might be interested in signing:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/212105
